vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-8` package. stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `gcc-8`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/viewcvs/gcc/trunk/gcc/config/arm/arm-protos.h?revision=266379&view=markup) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12886) - [MISC](https://www.gnu.org/software/gcc/gcc-8/changes.html)
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-8/libstdc++6

vulnerabilities.title: Insufficient Entropy
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-8` package. The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `gcc-8`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-15847) - [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=91481) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00056.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00057.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-05/msg00058.html)
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-8/libstdc++6

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3326) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210304-0007/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27256) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7d88c6142c6efc160c0ee5e4f85cde382c072888) - [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/28/2)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)

vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc6

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libidn2` package. GNU libidn2 before 2.2.0 fails to perform the roundtrip checks specified in RFC3490 Section 4.2 when converting A-labels to U-labels. This makes it possible in some circumstances for one domain to impersonate another. By creating a malicious domain that matches a target domain except for the inclusion of certain punycoded Unicode characters (that would be discarded when converted first to a Unicode label and then back to an ASCII label), arbitrary domains can be impersonated. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libidn2`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/614117ef6e4c60e1950d742e3edf0a0ef8d389de) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12290) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3UFT76Y7OSGPZV3EBEHD6ISVUM3DLARM/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KXDKYWFV6N2HHVSE67FFDM7G3FEL2ZNE/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ONG3GJRRJO35COPGVJXXSZLU4J5Y42AT/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RSI4TI2JTQWQ3YEUX5X36GTVGKO4QKZ5/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/U6ZXL2RDNQRAHCMKWPOMJFKYJ344X4HL/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-63) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/241e8f486134793cb0f4a5b0e5817a97883401f5) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/merge_requests/71) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-12/msg00008.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-12/msg00009.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12290) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4168-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Privilege Chaining
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-8` package. stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `gcc-8`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/viewcvs/gcc/trunk/gcc/config/arm/arm-protos.h?revision=266379&view=markup) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12886) - [MISC](https://www.gnu.org/software/gcc/gcc-8/changes.html)
name: gcc-8/libgcc1
gcc-8/gcc-8-base
gcc-8/libstdc++6
gcc-8/libstdc++6
gcc-8/libstdc++6

vulnerabilities.title: Insufficient Entropy
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `gcc-8` package. The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `gcc-8`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-15847) - [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=91481) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00056.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00057.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-05/msg00058.html)
name: gcc-8/libgcc1
gcc-8/gcc-8-base

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618) - [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)
name: glibc/libc6
glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-33574) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. The GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.32 could overflow an on-stack buffer during range reduction if an input to an 80-bit long double function contains a non-canonical bit pattern, a seen when passing a 0x5d414141414141410000 value to sinl on x86 targets. This is related to sysdeps/ieee754/ldbl-96/e_rem_pio2l.c. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-10029) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-10029) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JZTFUD5VH2GU3YOXA2KBQSBIDZRDWNZ3/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VU5JJGENOK7K4X5RYAA5PL647C6HD22E/) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/23N76M3EDP2GIW4GOIQRYTKRE7PPBRB2/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25487) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=9333498794cde1d5cca518badf79533a24114b6f) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200327-0003/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-03/msg00033.html) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. An out-of-bounds write vulnerability was found in glibc before 2.31 when handling signal trampolines on PowerPC. Specifically, the backtrace function did not properly check the array bounds when storing the frame address, resulting in a denial of service or potential code execution. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1751) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1751) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202006-04) - [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25423) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1751) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/)
name: glibc/libc6
glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package. A use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue. A local attacker could exploit this flaw by creating a specially crafted path that, when processed by the glob function, would potentially lead to arbitrary code execution. This was fixed in version 2.32. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `glibc`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25414) - [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=glibc.git;h=ddc650e9b3dc916eab417ce9f79e67337b05035c) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-1752) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200511-0005/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-1752) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4416-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1752)
name: glibc/libc6
glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt20` package. It was discovered that there was a ECDSA timing attack in the libgcrypt20 cryptographic library. Version affected: 1.8.4-5, 1.7.6-2+deb9u3, and 1.6.3-2+deb8u4. Versions fixed: 1.8.5-2 and 1.6.3-2+deb8u7. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libgcrypt20`. ## References - [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13627) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/09/msg00024.html) - [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/01/msg00001.html) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13627) - [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-32) - [GitHub Release](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/releases/tag/libgcrypt-1.8.5) - [MISC](https://minerva.crocs.fi.muni.cz/) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00060.html) - [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-01/msg00018.html) - [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/02/2) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13627) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-1/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-2/) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4236-3/)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libidn2` package. GNU libidn2 before 2.2.0 fails to perform the roundtrip checks specified in RFC3490 Section 4.2 when converting A-labels to U-labels. This makes it possible in some circumstances for one domain to impersonate another. By creating a malicious domain that matches a target domain except for the inclusion of certain punycoded Unicode characters (that would be discarded when converted first to a Unicode label and then back to an ASCII label), arbitrary domains can be impersonated. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `libidn2`. ## References - [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/614117ef6e4c60e1950d742e3edf0a0ef8d389de) - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12290) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3UFT76Y7OSGPZV3EBEHD6ISVUM3DLARM/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KXDKYWFV6N2HHVSE67FFDM7G3FEL2ZNE/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ONG3GJRRJO35COPGVJXXSZLU4J5Y42AT/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RSI4TI2JTQWQ3YEUX5X36GTVGKO4QKZ5/) - [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/U6ZXL2RDNQRAHCMKWPOMJFKYJ344X4HL/) - [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202003-63) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/commit/241e8f486134793cb0f4a5b0e5817a97883401f5) - [MISC](https://gitlab.com/libidn/libidn2/merge_requests/71) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-12/msg00008.html) - [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-12/msg00009.html) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12290) - [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4168-1/)

vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `sqlite3` package. vulnerabilities.title: Privilege Chaining
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can get new privileges through the execution of SUID binaries, which would allow to create binaries owned by the service transient group with the setgid bit set. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3844) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3844) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108096) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3844)
name: systemd/libudev1

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
vulnerabilities.description: ## NVD Description **Note:** Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `systemd` package. It was discovered that a systemd service that uses DynamicUser property can create a SUID/SGID binary that would be allowed to run as the transient service UID/GID even after the service is terminated. A local attacker may use this flaw to access resources that will be owned by a potentially different service in the future, when the UID/GID will be recycled. ## Remediation There is no fixed version for `Debian:10` `systemd`. ## References - [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3843) - [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/5JXQAKSTMABZ46EVCRMW62DHWYHTTFES/) - [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0002/) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3843) - [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108116) - [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4269-1/) - [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3843)
